means: 破口，崩溃处，裂缝( crevasse的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: Splays are commonly formed by currents from crevasses in levees.
sentence.Network_cn: 嗽叭形堆积通常由堤防决口的洪流所形成.

sentence.Network_en: The upper surface of glacier is riven by crevasses.
sentence.Network_cn: 冰川的上表面已裂成冰隙.

sentence.Network_en: Ice streams moving through ice sheet leave crevasses at their sides as they lurch forward.
sentence.Network_cn: 冰流穿越冰原而移动,当它踉跄前进时,会在两侧留下冰隙并形成缺口.

list.abs: 明裂缝 Crevasse暗裂缝 Hiddent crevasse平台 Plateau
longitudinal crack 纵向裂缝longitudinal crevasse 纵裂缝longitudinal damping 纵阻尼
Cretadiscus 白垩盘石crevasse channel 决口水道crevasse 裂缝
裂隙脊 crevasse ridge裂隙填积 crevasse filling-

entry.def: A crevasse is a large, deep crack in thick ice or rock.

auth_sentence.content: He is assessing crevasses, plotting our afternoon.
auth_sentence.res_content: He is assessing crevasses, plotting our afternoon.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He is assessing crevasses, plotting our afternoon.

auth_sentence.content: He feared the deep crevasses down which a man might slide.
auth_sentence.res_content: He feared the deep crevasses down which a man might slide.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He feared the deep crevasses down which a man might slide.

auth_sentence.content: The PIG has many deep crevasses that are too dangerous to traverse.
auth_sentence.res_content: The PIG has many deep crevasses that are too dangerous to traverse.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The PIG has many deep crevasses that are too dangerous to traverse.
